content: स्थितिः {%<ab>f.</ab>%} [स्था-क्तिन्] {@--1@} Standing, remaining, staying, abiding, living, stay, residence; स्थितिं नो रे दध्याः क्षणमपि मदांधेक्षण सखे <ls>Bv. 1. 52</ls>; रक्षोगृहे स्थितिर्मूलमग्निशुद्धौ त्वनिश्चयः <ls>U. 1. 6.</ls> {@--2@} Stopping, standing still, continuance in one state; प्रस्थितायां प्रतिष्ठेथाः स्थितायां स्थितिमाचरेः <ls>R. 1. 89.</ls> {@--3@} Remaining stationary, fixity, steadiness, firmness, steady application or devotion; मम भूयात् परमात्मनि स्थितिः <ls>Bv. 4. 23</ls>; <ls>Māl. 5. 22.</ls> {@--4@} A state, position, situation, condition. {@--5@} Natural state, nature, habit; अथ वा स्थितिरियं मंदमतीनां <ls>H. 4.</ls> {@--6@} Stability, permanence, perpetuation, continuance; वंशस्थितेरधिगमान्महति प्रमोदे <ls>V. 5. 15</ls>; कन्यां कुलंस्य स्थितये स्थितिज्ञः <ls>Ku. 1. 18</ls> <ls>R. 3. 27.</ls> {@--7@} Correctness of conduct, steadfastness in the path of duty, decorum, duty, moral rectitude, propriety; <ls>R. 3. 27</ls>, <ls n="R.">11. 65</ls>, <ls n="R.">12. 31</ls>; <ls>Ku. 1. 18</ls>; <ls>Ś. 5. 10</ls>, {@--8@} Maintenance of discipline, establishment of good order (in astate); <ls>R. 1. 25.</ls> {@--9@} Rank, dignity, high station or rank. {@--10@} Maintenance, sustenance; <ls>Māl. 9. 32</ls>, <ls>R. 5. 9.</ls> {@--11@} Continuance in life, preservation (one of the three states of human beings); सर्गस्थितिप्रत्यवहारेहतुः <ls>R. 2. 44</ls>; <ls>Ku. 2. 6.</ls> {@--12@} Cessation, pause, stop. {@--13@} Wellbeing, welfare. {@--14@} Consistency. {@--15@} A settled rule, ordinance, decree, an axiom or maxim. {@--16@} Settled determination. {@--17@} Term, limit, boundary. {@--18@} Inertia, resistance to motion. {@--19@} Duration of an eclipse. {@--20@} Regard, consideration, account; नासां च वयसि स्थितिः <ls>Pt. 1. 143.</ls>
